meanings.definition: Serve as a prelude or introduction to something else.
meanings.sent1: The soft music preluded the start of the play.
meanings.sent2: The sunrise preluded the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds preluded the arrival of the morning.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder preluded the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze preluded the onset of autumn.

meanings.definition: To precede or come before something else.
meanings.sent1: The appetizers preluded the main course at the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The opening act preluded the headlining band at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The teaser trailer preluded the release of the new movie.
meanings.sent4: The warm-up exercises preluded the intense workout session.
meanings.sent5: The introductory paragraph preluded the detailed explanation in the essay.
